articles.info:
I am a self-motivated, confident Makers Academy graduate who is capable of grasping new concepts with ease and working on my own initiative. Having transitioned into the world of tech after having a background in Finance, I have strong analytical and problem solving skills which will assist me in the day to day challenges.

For me, technology, is the ultimate portable career. Software development permits me to tap into my creative side while working on projects that I am passionate about.

I am looking for a Junior Software Developer role in an environment which provides me with the opportunity to prosper as well as enabling me to apply and enhance the skills I currently possess.

articles.heading: Newsquawk
articles.info:
Newsquawk is a company that delivers news to traders. As as Junior developer the role involves:
Developing applications in an agile enviroment using Ruby, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, as well as external APIs.
Help re-engineer and continuosly improve existing applications.
Assesing users needs, design a potential solution and then selecting the most suitsble software - taking that through to the development stage.

articles.heading: The Collective
articles.info:
The Collective is a property developemnt company built around the idea of co-living. As part of the finance teams the duties were as follows:
Control expenses by completing and receiving payments.
Process, verify and reconcile invoices on Xero i.e. weekly payment runs.
Liaise with suppliers to address disputes and payment failure issues.
Produce aged payables/receivables reports â€“ communicate with clients who have missed a payment, agree and schedule payments to bring them back on track.
Assist with producing analyses of accounts and monthly reports (management accounts).
Ensure compliance with all company policies and procedures.
Post customer payments by recording cash, cheques, and credit card transactions.

articles.heading: Kings Road Medical Centre
articles.info: As a receptionist duties included; arranging patient appointments, filing patient records and answering telephone queries.

articles.heading: Union Bank of India
articles.info: 4-week long internship which involved a rotation programme allowing myself to gain an insight into the various roles and positions held in the bank. The areas in which the programme covered: HR, Risk, Audit, Treasury, Branch, IT & Security. Duties include: carrying out tasks in the branch (opening of bank accounts, checking/updating individual details using a software programme, filing) understanding the duties and daily roles of those in the Risk and Audit Department as well as, the HR department.

articles.heading: Coding Bootcamp
articles.info: 12 Week Full Stack Software Developing Bootcamp focused on OOD and TDD. The course taught me that once you know one language it is so easy to learn a new language. Some of these languages included; Ruby, JavaScript, Ruby on Rails. At the end of the course a final group project was completed, built in Xcode using Swift as a language. The problem we wanted to tackle with this app was food waste on a small scale. The app generates recipes based on available ingredients inputted.

articles.heading: BSc Economics & Finance - 2:1
articles.info:
Three year course.
Modules included: Econometrics, Microeconomics,
 Macroeconomics, Fiancial Economics and Capital Markets.

articles.info: As part of the Makers Academy course, a friend and I set up an instagram page to showcase the projects worked on throughout the course.
